Web Development Glossary

The A-Zs of Web Development

The A-Zs of the Web Development

Post Type

A post type is a custom content type in WordPress that allows developers to create and manage different types of content, such as blog posts, pages, and custom post types, with their own unique attributes and functionality.

Post Types

Post Types are custom content types in WordPress that allow developers to create and manage different types of content, such as blog posts, pages, and custom post types, with their own unique attributes and functionality.

Post

Post is a built-in content type in WordPress that allows users to create and publish articles, news, and other types of written content on their website.

Press This

Press This is a bookmarklet tool in WordPress that allows users to quickly grab content from any web page and publish it as a new post on their WordPress site.

Primary Menu

The Primary Menu is a customizable navigation bar that allows users to easily access important pages and content on a WordPress website.

Profile

A Profile in Wordpress is a user-specific page that displays personal information and settings for each individual user.

Property

Property is a custom post type in WordPress that allows users to create and manage listings for real estate, rentals, or any other type of property.

Query

A query is a request for specific information from a WordPress database, typically used to retrieve posts or pages based on certain criteria.

QuickPress

QuickPress is a streamlined content creation tool within the WordPress platform that allows users to quickly publish posts or pages without navigating through the full WordPress dashboard.

Responsive design

Responsive design is a development approach that ensures a website or theme adapts to different screen sizes and devices, providing an optimal user experience, and is essential for any modern WordPress site.
